preface.title: Foreword: ${project.version}
preface.para: This is an initial pre-alpha version of the Maven Cookbook, and I mean "pre-alpha". If you are coming to the book with the expectation that this is a polished product, please check back in a few months, we're going to be developing this content over the next few months, and you should expect at least two chapters a month for the next five or six. I'm convinced that this will be a better book because people are going to have a window into the process, you will be able to see the false starts, outline revisions, and other parts of the writing process that are usually hidden from view. You'll be able to give us feedback and reviews even before we've stated that the content is ready for review.

What's up with this cover image (on the PDF)? It is a Galaxy, the Barred Spiral Galaxy NGC 1300 to be exact, and the picture is a composite of images from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope. NGC 1300 is 61 million light-years away and it is 110,000 light-years across. Why a Galaxy? Two reasons: First reason, because a Galaxy is a good analogy for the ecosystem that surrounds Maven. If Maven were the massive energetic core of a galaxy, the various projects and plugins that provide Maven's functionality are the various solar systems and star clusters that comprise the bulk of what you see when you look at a galaxy. While Maven: The Definitive Guide is going to be focused on the core of Maven, this book is focused on the various objects one would encounter in the "spiral arms". Second reason I used this picture, because it's a cool picture that is in the public domain. (Just in case you are curious, your own galaxy, The Milky Way, is a Spiral Galaxy that has a logarithmic spiral shape, measurements from the Spitzer Space Telescope in 2005 confirmed that our own galaxy is a barred spiral galaxy.)

And another thing, we're calling this thing a "book", but doesn't the term seem a bit archaic at the moment? This book is more of a periodical (as are most of our books), they change and evolve as the community and software evolves. Admittedly, parts of our other books tend to converge to a stable point, but even the most basic parts of Maven: The Definitive Guide are open to change. Despite this constant evolution, we are currently investigating new ways to make this content available as a regular, printed book for those of you who would like a copy.
